meanings.definition: A sensory cell or organ that detects electrical signals in living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The electroreceptor in the fish helps it sense the electric fields around it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the electroreceptor in sharks to understand how they detect prey.
meanings.sent3: The curious electroreceptor in the eel always knows when a storm is coming.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like an electroreceptor, always picking up on subtle changes in the environment.
meanings.sent5: The electroreceptor in the platypus is so sensitive, it can detect the smallest electrical impulses.

meanings.definition: A specialized receptor that responds to electrical stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The electroreceptor on the robot's sensor panel detected the incoming electrical signals.
meanings.sent2: The electroreceptor on the skin of some animals helps them navigate through dark environments.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning electroreceptor in the machine kept giving false alarms.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like an electroreceptor, always alert to the slightest changes in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The electroreceptor in the insect's antennae allows it to sense electrical charges in the air.
